intro: Tetrastigma obtectum var. obtectum, commonly known as the climbing ivy grape, is a vining plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its tendrils that aid in climbing. The leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a glossy surface. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that develop into berries. This plant is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and ability to cover trellises or walls.
